199501.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability. The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Ju-88, which was used in the Battle of Britain and the remainder of World War II.
199501.name: Table Air Combat: Ju-88

199502.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the A6M-2 Zero. The Zero has an unmatched cornering ability and powerful 20mm cannons. Its only fault is a fragile airframe.
199502.name: Table Air Combat: A6M-2 Zero

199503.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the A6M5 Zero. The Zero has an unmatched cornering ability and powerful 20mm cannons. The A6M5 is the most-produced variant which has improved speed over its predecessors. It retains its cornering ability with a weight half that of its arch-rival, the F6F Hellcat.
199503.name: Table Air Combat: A6M5 Zero

boardgameintegration.199847: Table Air Combat: B-17F Flying Fortress

199504.name: Table Air Combat: Spitfire V
199504.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Spitfire V, which was was the most-produced variant and considered by many to be the definitive Spitfire. Compared to the Spitfire II, The Spitfire V has heavier armement and much greater speed, as the cost of some maneuverability. This Spitfire is in desert camouflage, perfect for battles in the Mediterranean theater.

199505.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Ki-84 Hayate. Known as "Frank" to the allies, the Ki-84 design was a departure from the agile and delicate Zero. The Frank was less maneuverable, but was much faster and had pilot armour and self-sealing fuel tanks.
199505.name: Table Air Combat: Ki-84 Frank

199506.name: Imaginative NPCs
199506.description:
From the introduction:

Delve right in to your D&D world and populate it with some of the most peculiar, intriguing, and imaginative NPCs you can find. Developing a character can take an awful lot of time and effort, and for a good reason; they are people and beings with a history of their own. Any one NPC can have as much background as a player and can add just as much emphasis on any storyline. This document has been specially assembled to help you introduce brilliant characters to your world for you and your players to enjoy without the hassle.

199507.description: This small expansion introduces 6 "envoy" cards, each of which provides a special power. Similar to Alien cards in the base game, these cards are acquired by assigning a particular die to the card. However, unlike the Alien cards, the envoys provide a recurring power (once per turn) to the owning player. The envoy cards stay with a player until another player takes it away (by assigning the appropriate die). The 6 different cards are marked with the "blue" die, numbers 1-6, so players may only take these cards by assigning the blue die of the appropriate value.
199507.name: Cosmic Run Envoy Expansion

199508.description: This 12 card pack provides 12 unique Institute cards for use with the base game. The new cards provide a variety of powers, some of which affect the Portal and/or the Ethereal Realm -- in contrast to the base game. In addition, there is a recommended rule change regarding the game ending condition; players may now win the game by having 3 more character cards than his/her opponent.
199508.name: The Institute for Magical Arts: Ethereal Powers Expansion

199509.description: This 5-card expansion pack to Capo dei Capi includes 5 "apprentices". At the start of a turn, a player chooses one of the 5 cards to use for that turn. Each card offers a unique power. After the turn, the player returns the card (face-down) to the supply. Once all 5 cards have been used, they are turned face-up and may again be chosen by the player taking a turn.
199509.name: Capo dei Capi: Apprentices Expansion

199510.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 698)
199510.description:
In this issue:


Brief word from Johnn
Schrödinger's Characters
Building The Klok'k'ot, Part II

199511.name: Roleplaying Tips (Issue 695)
199511.description:
Roleplaying Tips
Issue 695

Crossing swords with Factions - How to Build Quick Guilds for Your Kingdom

199512.name: To Be Remembered
199512.description:
User summary:

This rules-light storytelling game is intended to be a simple introduction to roleplaying for inexperienced players. The game is designed for two players - a game master and a player - but couple probably work with more. There is no particular mechanical structure or process to the game; instead, the game master frames scenes and asks leading questions and the player responds with narrative.

199513.name: Big Bad Overlord
199513.description:
Big Bad Overlord is a card and dice game for 4-6 people in which players assume the roles of evil Dukes vying to take over the world. Players gather minions great and small, ranging from Riff-Raff to Horrible Monsters, battle each other, and fend off attacks by occasional do-gooders (such as adventuring bands and small children). The game takes about an hour to play.

The goal is to eliminate all other players and become the Big Bad Overlord. Players start with six cards, half of which they can keep face-down. The face-up cards serve as the players' armies and can be used to attack other players. Each turn, players draw a new card and add it to their army. (Unless they draw a do-gooder, in which case the player has to fight it off!) There are three combat abilities - Mind control, Magic, and Melee. Most cards have at least one ability, and some have more. A successful Mind-control attack allows you to capture an enemy card; magic blows things up (especially cards weak against magic, such as the otherwise powerful Machines-O-Death); and melee allows you to chop things up.

Players fight each other using all available attacks, rolling 2 six-sided dice to determine the winner of each battle. Die rolls are modified according to the relative attack and defense strengths of each side's army in each combat category. But even the most lopsided of battles isn't in vain - a natural 12 always wins, no matter what the modifiers, and a natural 2 always fails.

In addition to the evil minions and do-gooders, the deck contains two magical artifacts. They're important because players need them to survive the endgame. When all the cards are drawn from the deck, only players who have an artifact survive. At that point, if two players are still in the game, there's a final battle in which the evil Dukes use the artifacts to smash each other's troops.

Players can gang up on each other, help each other defend against attack, backstab each other, and more. Defeat your foes, play them against each other, hoard a precious artifact or obtain one at all costs - Big Bad Overlord is a game where it's good to be bad.

199514.name: Grind Them Down
199514.description:
A depressing story game about humans who give up on their dreams

From the introduction:

This game is about people giving up on their dreams, due to unseen forces trying to ruin their lives. Players will represent demons that hunger to take dreams away from humans. Each player can spend a round representing a human whose life the other demons are trying to ruin. The demons will take turns interfering with the human’s life, trying to convince the human to give up on a dream, while the other demons will offer terrible compromises to let the human cling to hope. The demons who convince the human to give up on a dream get to keep that dream. The demons continue grinding the human down until they have given up all their dreams, and the next player can create a human with their own dreams. At the end of the game, the demons compare who has devoured the most dreams.

199515.name: Ray Gigant
199515.description:
The game takes place in a fictional, future version of Tokyo that has been left in ruins due to the invasion of space aliens called "Gigants". While the entire Earth has been largely laid to waste, before complete destruction, the game's primary character, Ichiya Amakaze, is finally able to defeat a Gigant with a mysterious power called "Yorigami".

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ray_Gigant Ray Gigant]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199516.name: The Empty City
199516.description:
User summary:

The game is played solitaire, with turns generating public tweets. If multiple players are tweeting at the same time to the same recipients there is a convention to allow the games to influence each other. Otherwise, play involves starting at position one on a flowchart and then following the instructions through to completion.

199517.name: Push Me Pull You

videogamehonor.33347: 2015 SXSW Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee

199517.description:
Push Me Pull You is a sports game for 2–4 players.

Joined at the waist, you and your partner share a single worm-like body as you wrestle your opponent for control of the ball.

It’s a bit like a big hug, or playing soccer with your small intestines.

Source: The Game Website.

199518.name: The Lab

videogamehonor.39262: 2016 Global Game Awards Best VR Game of the Year Winner

199518.description:
The Lab is a Portal-based title developed by Valve Corporation, and released for Microsoft Windows on April 5, 2016. It utilizes virtual reality (VR) gaming technology and the HTC Vive device to showcase a series of gaming experiences accessed through a hub room. The game offers eight different game types that involve short demo experiences that utilize different aspects of the VR capabilities. Variety is also offered beyond the experiences themselves by the amount of interactability with objects in the environment that is included.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lab_%28video_game%29 The Lab (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199519.name: Play by Play
199519.description:
From the introduction:

You and two or more friends take turns silently acting out characters and, as an audience, providing commentary and trying to guess performer roles.

User summary:

Play involves the use of custom cards; they are provided as print-and-play components in the document.

199520.name: Nothing is Forever
199520.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are defined by Traits, which can be Skills, areas of interest, or simply areas of experience. They are defined by the player during creation. Traits have positive modifiers that are used during action resolution.

Action resolution uses a modified 2d10 roll against a target difficulty. In the game, the game master never rolls dice - players take all the actions. The game presents a compelling setting that is well-developed and cohesive (given the length of the document).

199521.name: Night Terror (2015)
199521.description:
User summary:

The game does not use a game master but does require one person to perform some setup and introductory actions. Additionally, one player becomes the primary focus of the narrative and the remaining players act as a group. The game uses custom cards that are provided as print-and-play components in the document.

Players are asked a series of questions based on rational or irrational philosophical fallacies. Familiarity with philosophical logic is presupposed by the game (this may be a barrier to entry for some).

199522.name: Tales Across Time
199522.description:
User Summary

This JRPG follows three characters from the same location but from different time periods.

199523.name: 2D Driving Simulator
199523.description:
User Summary

Park a car, avoiding hazards and using the drive/reverse control and a miniature steering wheel.

199524.name: Avernum 2: Crystal Souls
199524.description:
Spiderweb Software returns once again to its epic creation, to tell a story of imprisonment, war, and a desperate fight for survival. Avernum 2: Crystal Souls is the second chapter in this classic indie fantasy role-playing saga, the tale of desperate exiles and their fight to keep their home.

Source: The Publisher Website.


Lots of new dialogue, locations, quests, special encounters, and stuff to explore.
The interface is completely redone in the style of Avernum 6, but with many interface improvements brought over from Avadon: The Black Fortress.
The game system has been heavily revised. It's a mix of Avernum 6 and Avadon: The Black Fortress. It is still entirely skill-based and most of the skills are the same. However, the way you train has changed. Instead of saving up skill points, each level you get to increase two skills.
The Traits system has been massively reworked. Instead of picking two traits at the beginning of the game, you can select one new beneficial trait every two levels.
A new, large town with a pile of quests.
New hidden dungeons.
New hidden characters with lots of backstory and things you can do for them.
A completely new starter dungeon/tutorial.

199525.name: Stratego Legends: Celams and Noslrac
199525.description:
Typically given away at conventions as a set, these promotional pieces for Stratego Legends add two new units with unique abilities to the game. Each piece comes with a game piece sticker and a rules reference sticker.


207 Celams (10) - Dragon - light army - Valorians (gold)


Ability: Reveal Celams when a piece flies over her to destroy the piece that flew over Celams.
Action: Flying. Reveal Celams to jump her over any number of pieces or water spaces vertically or horizontally. Celams must land on the first empty space when flying.


208 Noslrac (10) - Mutant - dark army - Qa'ans (purple)


Ability: Reveal Noslrac and an adjacent Mutant to give that Mutant +2 until the end of turn. Use this ability only once per turn.
Death Curse: When this Death Curse ends, chosen opponent destroys 5 pieces under his control simultaneously. Then choose and destroy 3 pieces under your control simultaneously.

199526.name: Tigers on the Hunt
199526.description:
Tigers on the Hunt is a World War 2 hard-core tactical wargame for PC.
It creates a truly and immersive tactical simulation. Tigers on the Hunt boasts a ferocious and adaptive AI which will dynamically respond to a player’s maneuvers. Players can enjoy massive battles across up to 12 connected geomorphic maps with over 200 Infantry units, 100 Support Weapons, 100 Ordnance pieces and 50 Vehicles per side.

Source: The Publisher Website.

199527.description:
The Darkroot Basin rests in between the Darkroot Garden and the eastern walls of Undead Burg. This is a deep basin filled with streams and waterfalls. The damp nature has given rise to fungus and mushrooms.

Contains two iconic Dark Souls bosses -- Sif, the Great Grey Wolf and Knight Artorias.
199527.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Darkroot Basin Expansion

199528.description:
The CopyCat is a word-based, hidden-identity psychology card game. Players secretly assigned the CopyCat role must pretend they know the word or phrase that everyone else carefully describes based on hints and descriptions, while the other players try to identify and eliminate the CopyCats!

At the beginning of the game, players are assigned the roles of Human or CopyCat randomly without knowing each other's identity (minority CopyCat). A Topic Card will be randomly selected for each game. The Topic Card consists of a Topic and Hints. The Humans will be able to see the Topic while the CopyCats will only be able to see the Hints. After everyone have seen the Topic or Hints, players will take turns describing the Topic (or what CopyCats think may be close to the Topic) using a word or phrase. The Humans will have to give good descriptions to prove their allegiance, but vague enough as to not give CopyCats too much information. The CopyCats will have to give clever descriptions by combining the Hints with what they've heard in order to blend in with the Humans and prevent their elimination.

The Humans must eliminate the CopyCats before 2 rounds to win, or else the CopyCats win!

Things can get pretty heated, and there is limitless potential for creativity in how to strategize.
199528.name: The CopyCat

boardgameintegration.227088: Commissioner Victor: Case of elusive smugglers

199530.description:
The museum was closed on that day to not cover any tracks. The custodian, waddling back and forth on the red carpet, was plucking his hair out and quietly moaning each time he glanced at the empty space that the painting left. Guards were standing by the wall and looking at the tips of their boots. Unfortunately, the detectives did not have any good news. The perpetrator was a real pro – they did not leave anything that could lead us to him. Only those strange rumors about the man walking through the city streets, carrying a large package...

The detectives in Commissioner Victor: The lost painting case must set out to capture the art thief, and whoever succeeds will earn a promotion or mention in the local newspaper! Players assume the roles of the detectives who are helping Commissioner Victor look for the thief by using tiles with suspects' faces. The player who matches the most features of the perpetrator wins. It will not be easy though, as each player tries to prove that their suspect is guilty and will disrupt other players as much as possible. Deduction and logic needed!
199530.name: Commissioner Victor: The lost painting case

199532.name: Pocket Card Jockey
199532.description:
3, 2, 1… Go!
Stack cards like it's a race to the finish. And it is! In this fast-paced mash-up of solitaire and horse racing, you'll jockey your way to victory by clearing cards to energize your horse. You can even level up your noble steed through strategic positioning on the track. Can you master solitaire and horseback racing…at the same time?!

After you get a dozen races under your belt, you can retire your horse—a sad moment for any jockey. However! You can relocate your horse to your very own farm and pair them with other retired horses to breed new ponies...that are completely adorable! Eventually these babies will pony up by maturing into horses that you can ride in competitions for prizes. You can then get items at Chirp's shop, such as puzzle pieces or temporary bonuses. After completing certain puzzles, your horse will gain even more stats when leveling up. That’s some next-level jockeying!

Solitaire + Horses = one crazy-awesome gaming mash-up!
Jettison your horse down the track in this fast-paced form of solitaire
Level up your horses to enhance their stats
Retire horses to the farm to breed ponies, win more races, and earn more prizes

Source: The Publisher Website.

199533.name: Arthur et la Vengeance de Maltazard : le Jeu de Course
199533.description:
Help Arthur, Betameche, Selenia and Max reach the passage room as fast as possible ! The future of the Minimoys is in your hands !

Playing in turns, roll a direction and a speed dice to move your vehicle as fast as possible while avoiding Maltazard's soldiers and collecting bonus cards to help you be the first to reach the end of the race.

boardgameintegration.199847: Table Air Combat: B-17F Flying Fortress

199535.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the Ju-87B Stuka, a German dive-bomber which was used in the Battle of Britain.
199535.name: Table Air Combat: Ju-87B

199536.name: M.A.X. 2: Mechanized Assault & Exploration
199536.description:
M.A.X. 2: Mechanized Assault & Exploration (known in Europe as M.A.X. 2: Mechanised Assault & Exploration) is a 1998 hybrid real-time/turn-based strategy video game developed and published by Interplay Productions. It's a sequel to Mechanized Assault & Exploration.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mechanized_Assault_%26_Exploration_2 Mechanized Assault & Exploration 2]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199537.name: Tamagotchi Connection: Corner Shop 2
199537.description:
Tamagotchi Connection: Corner Shop 2 is a life simulation video game published and developed by Namco Bandai for the Nintendo DS handheld video game console. It is the sequel to Tamagotchi Connection: Corner Shop, also released for the Nintendo DS.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamagotchi_Connection%3A_Corner_Shop_2 Tamagotchi Connection: Corner Shop 2]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

199538.name: Astral Knights
199538.description:
From publisher blurb:

Delve into the mind-shattering and copyright infringement-free world of psionics with the Astral Knights! Features include

a new magic system (psionics!)
two new character classes—the Light Path Astral Knight and the Dark Path Astral Knight
new skill: Psionicist and the meditation ability anyone can learn! ANYONE!
Psionic Nature
new gear: Astral Blades
new conflicts: sparring, dueling and killing
psionic disciplines
blue ghosts!




May the Fourth be with you!

199539.name: Eastern Expeditions: The Samurai
199539.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the samurai to your original edition games! The samurai has been represented in role-playing games from the days of the earliest edition but has been plagued by imbalance and inaccuracies. The Eastern Expeditions™ line aims to address these issues.

Eastern Expeditions: The Samurai provides a complete character class based decidedly in the historical Japanese warrior, as well as Japanese weapons and armor suitable for a samurai’s use. The class is written for the Delving Deeper RPG, but with minor modifications could be used with any “old-school” RPG, including the advanced editions of the original fantasy game, Swords & Wizardry, and OSRIC!

199540.name: Eastern Expeditions: The Ninja
199540.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bring the ninja to your original edition games! The ninja has been represented in role-playing games from the days of the earliest edition but has been plagued by imbalance and fallacies. The Eastern Expeditions™ line aims to address these issues.

Eastern Expeditions: The Ninja provides a complete character class, as well as Japanese weapons, armor, and equipment suitable for a ninja’s use. The class is written for the Delving Deeper RPG, but with minor modifications could be used with any “old-school” RPG, including the advanced editions of the original fantasy game, Swords & Wizardry, and OSRIC!

199541.name: Detective Bullshit
199541.description:
Detective Bullshit is a game for 3-5 players you win by making shit up.

Think of Clue meets Cards Against Humanity, sort of. It's a competitive storytelling game centered around a fictional criminal case. Unlike Clue, there's no right answer, but like Cards Against Humanity, the fun is in getting your friends to pick your ridiculous story.

For each case, one player is Chief Bullshit and other players are detectives.

The Chief draws a victim card and decides the location of the crime. It's then up to the other detectives to play suspect cards from their hands and convince the Chief that their suspect is guilty. But things get complicated in the 3 rounds of each case as additional evidence, complications, and bribery keep even the best bullshitters on their toes.

199542.description:
A mini expansion of six cards, released exclusively to backers of the spiele-offensive crowdfunding campaign.

This contains three Planned Work cards, and three Order cards.
199542.name: Lignum: Spiele-offensive Exclusives

199543.description: A mini expansion for Lignum that consists of 1 wooden disk in each player's color and a special rules supplement. This expansion allows for more accurate planning.
199543.name: Lignum: Reserve Expansion

199544.description:
This is a set of official meeple stickers for the meeples in Lignum, which help players tell them apart from each other, because under a warm light the purple meeples look similar to the brown meeples.

These stickers were originally available to backers of the crowdfunding campaign, and then later made available through spielmaterial's website.
199544.name: Lignum: Meeple Stickers

199545.name: Dormitory Rooms
199545.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 301st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a number of slightly medieval or fantasic dormitory rooms.

The map is 14 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 4 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2880 pixels in size at 144dpi.

199546.name: The Lost Tower of Viondor (5E)
199546.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Lost Tower of Viondor is a 5e adventure for characters of 7th to 9th level, using the Primeval Thule Campaign Setting.

A ghostly ship on the Sea of Mists, a frozen wreck in the Thousand Teeth, and the long-lost legacy of an arrogant archmage who stared the doom of Nimoth in the face and did not blink; these are the stepping stones to finding the forgotten Tower of Viondor. An Atlantean wizard of unparalleled inventiveness, the legendary Viondor would not flee with his kin when the glaciers approached. Hidden in the far glacial rifts of Nimoth his tower remains, with the wisdom of the ancients perhaps unguarded after his inevitable demise.

Inspired by the literary traditions of sword-and-sorcery adventure, lost worlds, and fantastic horror, the land of Primeval Thule is a savage, intense campaign setting.

199547.name: Dragons are Above My Pay Grade!
199547.description:
From publisher blurb:

A non-linear search for hidden artifacts that culminates in an attack on a huge red dragon, Dragons are Above My Pay Grade provides heroes with an electrifying start to their careers. Who doesn’t want to fight a dragon, even if it is above your pay grade?

Dragons are Above My Pay Grade is an adventure for 3 – 6 first level PCs using the Pathfinder RPG rules. It is 23 pages long, fully illustrated and in color.

Sunstone Island seemed like the perfect opportunity. Idyllic weather, pleasant beaches, docile animals, and, most importantly, a mine absolutely bursting with gold. Peter Grimples, owner of the Grimples Mining Corporation, was so enthusiastic to exploit these virgin resources that he personally headed the mining colony on this remote island.

The volcano? Looks pretty quiet. The tribe of kobolds? Nothing a group of wide-eyed heroes can’t handle.

That is, until the kobolds resurrect the red dragon Varaug onto the island. With reinforcements weeks away, suddenly the cheapest heroes money can buy don’t seem quite up to the task.
To combat this sudden and unexpected threat, the heroes must follow in the footsteps of the legendary native A’uapa who slew Varaug many centuries ago. Following the instructions of a turncoat kobold who would like nothing more than the death of the merciless dragon, the heroes collect the dragon-slaying tools of A’uapa hidden across Sunstone Island. These poisons, blessings, spells, and weapons are heavily guarded, sequestered in dungeons or protected by kobolds. As the heroes traverse the island, following clues, unlocking riddles, and completing challenges, their already formidable adversary grows stronger and the colony town that they call home grows weaker.

Can the heroes collect enough dragon-slaying weapons to defeat Varaug before he destroys the mining colony along with any chance of future employment? How could the party’s first contract go so wrong?

Dragons Are above My Pay Grade features a mining town, a fleshed out island with wild beasts and tropical hazards, a range of mini-dungeons and challenges, and a host of original enemies, spells, poisons, items, and traps. And, of course, the opportunity for level 1 character to face a red wyrm!

199548.name: Flint and Feather
199548.description:
From the publisher:

Flint and Feather is a 28mm, individual figure, tabletop skirmish game system of tribal warfare between the First Nations of the Great Lakes region in the legendary Pre-Contact era. Unleash your Great Warrior and assemble your Warband to raid and plunder your opponent and grow your Orenda.

Attack and Defense Card System: This unique combat system gives you the ability to choose the attack or defense maneuver of your key characters providing a critical decision point in the game during each and every melee you may fight.

Medicine Roll Initiative System: This creative initiative system allows interesting aspects of the Native American Indian mythology to be added into the game play and provides the game with more of a feel for the Legendary Pre-Contact period.

Orenda: This word is the Iroquoian name for the spiritual power inherent in people, animals and the environment. The rich Iroquoian mythology introduces aspects that allow us to creatively add magic, spells and spirit creatures to the game. Of course the wargame purist does not have to add these rules to the game if your inclination is for standard combat.

rpg.1568: Lord of the Rings Adventure Game

199549.name: Ironfist Campaign (Part I): Trouble in the Old City
199549.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your friends have been kidnapped! An enigmatic knight's clues lead you over and under the Old City of Antomille in search of them. In the process, you stumble across a dark conspiracy that could threaten the entire duchy.

This fantasy adventure is an authentic, old school roleplaying manuscript that I wrote in 1992. Originally run using Iron Crown Enterprises LORD OF THE RINGS ROLEPLAYING GAME (LOR), it can be played as is with MIDDLE EARTH ADVENTURE GAME (MEAG) or easily converted to your preferred system (conversion rules included).

rpg.1568: Lord of the Rings Adventure Game

199550.name: Ironfist Campaign (Part II): To the Orc Forest!
199550.description:
From publisher blurb:

An army from the Orc Forest prepares to march against the Duchy of Antomille! Find their fortress and guide a batallion of soldiers to destroy it before the invasion begins.

A HEROES & VILLAINS =galactic baroque= Fantasy Roleplaying Adventure set on the world of REDSUN.

This fantasy adventure is an authentic, old school roleplaying manuscript I wrote in 1993. Written originally to be played with Iron Crown Enterprises LORD OF THE RINGS ROLEPLAYING GAME (LOR), it can be played as is with MIDDLE EARTH ADVENTURE GAME (MEAG) or easily converted to your preferred system (conversion rules included).

199552.name: Pathfinder Adventures

videogamehonor.41836: 2016 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee

199552.description:
Role-players will find the game's character development very familiar. Characters have classes such as fighter, wizard, and rogue, as well as numbers that define strength, dexterity, intelligence, etc. You'll improve your character by acquiring new items, allies, spells, and weapons as you explore and overcome challenges; over time, you'll be able to customize your deck to better suit your own individual vision of your character.

Source: The Game Website.

199554.name: New York Bop
199554.description:
New York Bop is small scale skirmish game created by Ghetto Miniatures where you command a gang of local hoodlums looking to make a name for themselves in 1970’s New York.

Suitable for 2 or more players you will each take turns at activating your gang members to perform a number of actions. You will test your brawn against your enemies in a one on one fighting or will your gang up on the weaker enemies to take you on the path to glory.

The gang characters are represented by a detailed range of 28mm gang miniatures that each have a baseball style stats cards. All the gangs and their members have special attributes that will set them apart from their rivals who they want to get the better of.

A standard game of New York Bop is played with 8 gang members on a 3’ x 3’ surface. Games are fast paced and exciting and you can have a number of enjoyable games in one evening between friends.

Gang Warlords take control and can issue command orders to their street soldiers. You can tell your gang member to cause havoc in the streets by vandalising shops, breaking into cars and spray painting your gang logo on enemy turf in the ultimate 'Up Yours'.

Event cards in the rules add an element of unpredictability to the game as you never know when or what cards your rival is going to mess up your plans.

The rules will contain full campaign rules and map, which will allow you to fight over of New York’s Boroughs of Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens and The Bronx. You will start the campaign with a small gang and a number of turfs with the aim to expand your territory to increase your income and gang size.

As you battle through the campaign you will be able to expand your gang and upgrade member’s ranks and weapons with the income from the local shops protection money.

199555.name: Midvinter
199555.description:
In this cozy little point-and-click fairy-tale, you are a gnome on an abandoned farm. When you realize that humans have come to live there once more, you find yourself useful again - but also that you might have to work harder than ever to keep them safe from the dark creatures that lurk out in the forest. You might even have to call on some of the fair folks for help. Their aid, however, does not come without a price...

The game draws heavily from Swedish folk lore, with art inspired by artists such as John Bauer and Alvaro Tapia. It uses puzzles and riddles to tell its story, and there are several different ends to it. The player will also get to experience unique music and compelling voice over, as well as discover part of Sweden's history, since the game takes place in the 19th century - a time where over a million people left the country to avoid starvation and build a new life for themselves.

This game was created by one person, Anna Jenelius, over 6 months - plus composer Douglas Holmquist who made the wonderful music. It fits anyone who would like to experience an atmospheric and cozy fairy-tale, that might remind you of the stories you heard as a child.

Source: The Developer Website.

199557.name: Insane Insects: The Inception
199557.description:
The Final Conflict has ended. Earth exists no more. Following a relentless cycle of brutal engagements in which victory continued to narrowly elude the Overlords, a turning point was reached when they began to observe the characteristics of earth's most successful predators. Insect life-forms with their combination of strength, speed, aggression and durability were finally selected as the optimum design for the ultimate fighting machine. The resulting Predator was used to devastating effect in the last wave of battle which has become known as the Final Conflict. In the aftermath, the Overlords, in an ironic twist recreate parts of the earth they destroyed to serve as arenas. Here, the Predators, once used to annihilate the earth, now engage in combat for the entertainment of their creators.

Source: The Game Website.

199558.name: The Temporal Invasion
199558.description:
Do you want to feel like REAL Puzzle Solver and Explorer? EXPERIENCE this Story-driven Puzzle Hunt Game based on Alternate History, Murder Mystery, History, X-Files and Science Fiction.

Source: The Game Website.

199559.name: Three Weeks or Less
199559.description:
From the Introduction:

Just another day in the life of a TransGalaxy Class D freight hauler. You’ve got to get these cryopods to a mining penal colony, but it looks like the timer on the pods is going to expire before you get there. Will you still get paid if your cargo is spoiled?

Maybe you can get this hunk of junk to go a little faster...

199560.name: How to Run: An Advanced Guide to Managing Role-playing Games
199560.description:
User summary:

The book is divided into four parts: The Art of Presentation (6 chapters), Managing Yourself as DM (2 chapters), Managing Your Players (2 chapters) and Worldbuilding (4 chapters).

Publisher blurb:

In forty years, the role-playing community has sorely lacked a savvy investigation of the art of DMing, targeted exclusively for the long-standing enthusiast. For the first time, we have a book that presumes the reader knows what a role-playing game is, and how it is played, wasting no time covering old ground. Instead, How to Run exhaustively examines how to present the setting, handle players, draw forth emotion, cope with information overload and make a world from the ground up, step-by-step and point-by-point. Alexis Smolensk hasn’t written a dry, academic treatise of the game, he’s written an empowering field guide for grognards seeking illumination. No serious campaigner should venture forth without this book in their backpack!

225269.name: Sagrada Promo 1: Vitraux/Balboa Bay Window Pattern Card

199561.description:
Draft dice and use the tools-of-the-trade in Sagrada to carefully construct your stained glass window masterpiece.

In more detail, each player builds a stained glass window by building up a grid of dice on their player board. Each board has some restrictions on which color or shade (value) of die can be placed there. Dice of the same shade or color may never be placed next to each other. Dice are drafted in player order, with the start player rotating each round, snaking back around after the last player drafts two dice. Scoring is variable per game based on achieving various patterns and varieties of placement...as well as bonus points for dark shades of a particular hidden goal color.

Special tools can be used to help you break the rules by spending skill tokens; once a tool is used, it then requires more skill tokens for the next player to use them.

The highest scoring window artisan wins!
199561.name: Sagrada

199562.name: Star Force
199562.description:
From the PDF:

You are an officer of the STAR FORCE, the elite law enforcement organization that keeps the peace across the interstellar republic of the Consortium. You have earned the right to carry a SHIELD, a rare and powerful artifact that can project hard-light constructs controlled by your force of will.

199563.name: The Peridot (Issue 1 - Spring 2016)
199563.description:
A complete new Ancient Mesopotamian starter campaign setting with 30+ keyed hexes, new monsters and NPCs. Battle bulrush demons and scorpion-men, explore a thronged wilderness, forge your destiny in a world still young.



A grab-bag of interesting new monsters, NPCs, and magic items, including Heron Men, the Old Comrades, and the Weeping Woodwose.



A collection of scenarios to "plug in and play" to your campaign, including the Bone Miller, the Ichthyosaur's Pool, and Pan Chun Mei and Her Wraith Ravens.

199564.name: Adventurer Summoning (5e)
199564.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs are enjoying some much needed downtime in their base of operations, when suddenly and against their will they are summoned to another plane of existence to battle the foes of a powerful alien wizard.

User summary:

A mini adventure for four or five 10th level characters.

199565.name: Dead Tree Vale (5e)
199565.description:
From the introduction:

Dead Tree Vale is a small valley that lies along a road between Kelerak and Daven. Over two decades ago, a Zelandic Druid of questionable morality established a modest residence in a cave at the base of the Vale’s eastern ridgeline. The Druid, Calistin by name, befriended the local animals, encouraged the local plant life to grow and conceal his home, and conducted his research free of interference from other Druids, or anyone else for that matter. He experimented in human-animal hybrids, among other twisted past-times. His crowning achievement was a spell that would transform humans into a unique species of tree, while allowing the transformed subjects to retain full cognizance. Unfortunately, he was unable to perfect the spell, despite repeated attempts. Invariably, every human-turned-tree withered and died shortly after transformation, some lasting as much as a tenday and others less than twenty-four hours. It is possible that the spell itself was not flawed, and that the subjects simply succumbed to the shock of the event. (Calistin did not use volunteers interested in experiencing a tree’s life, preferring instead to prey on small parties of travelers foolish enough to camp for the night within the Vale’s confines.) He still inhabits the veil and preys on travelers, seeking to perfect his twisted experiments.

User summary:

A short adventure for four players of 7th level

199566.name: Haunted Dwarven Tomb (5e)
199566.description:
From the introduction:

Many years ago, dwarves from the Dwarfhold of Mithaud, or Mt. Silverload, prepared a site as a tomb for their venerable king. Prior to the king’s death, however, the crown prince and his family, while traveling, were brutally slain by a band of wandering Orlandish mercenaries. Groups of elite dwarven warriors were dispatched to capture or kill the murderers, and after several months one such group returned with the leader of the mercenary company as a prisoner. The king’s wrath knew no bounds, and he ordered the human imprisoned within the king’s own tomb. The mercenary was subsequently interred and a wall of magical force was erected to prevent his escape. Little did the
king know that the crown prince’s slayer was a man of such great evil as to be able to call upon the forces of darkness for aid in his struggle to survive being buried alive...

User summary:

A mini-adventure for four or five 11th - 12th level characters

199567.name: The Secret World - Issue 14: Call of the Nameless
199567.description:
Issue #14 brings us out of Tokyo and back to familiar turf. There have been strange rumblings in Egypt--quite literally--and The Stationmaster sends you to investigate. As you delve into six all-new main missions and assorted side missions, you’ll encounter Ptahmose and his Sentinels, and enlist the aid of an unlikely ally as you uncover the secret of this Ancient Egyptian mystery.

Source: The Publisher Website.

199568.name: Poleis: Ancient Cities
199568.description:
The poleis were the city-states of ancient Greece. Each state was like a political entity ruled by their own citizens. Your goal is to form the greatest Greek alliance, build wonders and be favored by deities.

COMPONENTS:

There are three types of cards:

POLIS CARDS, the backbone of the game, which provide resources, some abilities, Victory Points, trade routes, deity worshiping.

WONDERS CARDS, which give Victory Points. These require certain resources and once build they belong to that player.

DEITIES CARDS, give Victory Points. These require faith, they belong to the player that worships a certain deity the most - during turns these can switch among players.

GOAL:

The goal of the game is to win the most victory points.

SETUP:
The deities and wonders cards are placed face up in the middle of the table. The starting player will get two polis cards, the rest will form the draw deck.

GAMEPLAY:

During a round, a player, must draw until he has three cards in his hand. Then must choose one card and place it in front of him - once doing that he will acquire faith and resources symbols.

He then checks if he meets any deity or wonder requirements.

The round ends with the cards passed to the next player.

END OF GAME:

The game ends when all players have five polis cards in front of them, in a row.

SCORING:

Players add the Victory Points from Wonder Cards, Deities Cards, the longest trade route and any extra victory points from the polis cards.

199569.name: Into the Thieves' Guild (5e)
199569.description:
From the introduction:

The powerful thieves’ guild in Dragonspur City, the capital of Kelerak, is in the midst of a coup. Corfin Ack-Sembar has been the lieutenant of the Thieves’ Guild for nearly 15 years and he is sick of it. He wishes to be the head of the guild. But for some reason, all of his men are deathly afraid of the current head, one Lalsthor Longcloak. He has had no success paying anyone to assassinate Longcloak; indeed Corfin himself feels an irrational fear when he is in the mysterious presence of his leader. Therefore he has had to suffer as second in command. But recently he has hatched a scheme to depose Longcloak—word of powerful adventurers has reached him, and he believes he can manipulate these personages into doing his dirty work and slaying Longcloak. However, Longcloak is aware of Corfin’s plans, and he doesn’t aim to take them lying down. He has decided to try to trick the PCs into killing his rival so that he can remain in power. Both of the powerful guild leaders have allies in the town who will report on the doings of the PCs, giving the crooked leaders opportunity to manipulate them.

User summary:

An adventure for four or five 8th - 9th level characters.

199570.name: 21 Plots Second Edition
199570.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you planned an adventure and, suddenly, your players decide to go a different direction? Have you been working all week and need some inspiration for a weekend game? Are you having a mental block?

We're here to help!

The second edition of our insanely popular 21 Plots presents 21 situations with 6 possible outcomes for a Referee to use with a gaming group. Within these pages, you will find inspiration for 21 different games plus the possiblity of using the general set-up mulitple times using the remaining suggested endings.

Choose an ending! Or roll a d6 and let chance determine the outcome!

199571.name: Strange Shelter (5e)
199571.description:
From the introduction:

The heroes are in the middle of a long journey, passing through a semi-wilderness area. The area was controlled by goblinoids until recently, and some are said still to prowl the area.

The characters take shelter from a storm in an abandoned farmhouse that is not what it seems. During the night, a ghost uses their dreams to take them back in time to the destruction of the farmhouse and the slaughter of its inhabitants to give the heroes a chance to prevent it.

User summary:

A mini-adventure for four or five 6th level characters.

199572.name: Wyvern Attack! (5e)
199572.description:
From the introduction:

The PCs investigate rumors of a plot to seize the local copper mines and in doing so they suffer a wyvern attack and possibly unveil the town’s mayor as the real villain. The heroes may also end up exploring an abandoned mine and confronting two wyverns and an orcish shaman in their cliff-top lair.

User summary:

An adventure for four or five characters of 7th - 8th level.

199573.name: Funedco
199573.description:
According to the publisher, this educational card game is "designed to improve vocabularies, improve spelling and provide profitable entertainment". The game consists of a pack of 72 cards, each of which bears a single letter of the alphabet in large print. The deck has between one and six cards of any given letter.

Six cards are dealt to each player. The dealer begins by playing one of his cards and announcing a word starting with that letter. Subsequent players must play the next letter in a word on the board if they can, or start a new word if they cannot. They then draw a card from the deck to replace the one played.

After each player has had a chance to play on a word that has been announced, subsequent players may change the announced word to any other that word that includes in order the letters already played.

Players get points for completing words, ranging from 5 points for a 2-letter word to a maximum of 1,000 points for a 10-letter word. Each time a player takes a trick by completing a word, he may also "declare" another word for which he has all the necessary letters in his hand. He scores for that word as well, and then ends his turn as usual by drawing a card. Winner is first to 2,000 points.

199574.name: Sanctum Secorum (Issue #12 - May 2016)

rpg.10737: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

199574.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue we explore the world of Gardner F Fox's Kothar: Barbarian Swordsman. So this issue is loaded with bonus content to bring to your game: classes, magic items and so much more...

Character Classes

Barbarian - Diogo Nogueira
Barbarian - David Baity

Gods of the Eternal Struggle

Astrol - Bob Brinkman
Dwallka of the War Hammer - Bob Brinkman
Eldrak of the Seven Hells - Bob Brinkman
Elwys the Golden - Bob Brinkman
Omorphon - Bob Brinkman

Magic Items

Frostfire - Bob Brinkman

Monsters

Azdorian Spider - David Baity
Ink Wraith - David Baity
Iormungar, Sea Dragon - Bob Brinkman
Lich - Bob Brinkman
Minokar - Bob Brinkman

Spells

Phlogiston Storm - Bob Brinkman
Wizard Cage - Jen Brinkman

199575.name: Legendary Hybrids: Deadeye Hexer
199575.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hot Lead and Cold Hexes!

Legendary Hybrids: Deadeye Hexer is the latest volume in our series of class-focused player supplements, introducing a new series of hybrid classes like those in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Class Guide that blend the core elements of two different base classes into a unique synergy all their own. The deadeye hexer brings you a 20-level hybrid class that combines the mysterious magical arts of witchcraft with a gunslinger's fearsome focus on firearms. A lethal loner with a fell reputation, a deadeye hexer's merest glance causes enemies to quail before him as he hurls hot lead and harrowing hexes with equal authority. Where witches commune with the spirits through the natural world, a deadeye hexer's silent companion is his steely peacemaker. Through it he hears the cold and brutal whispers of an uncaring universe that unfold to him the harsh truths of fate and grant him the power to bring final judgment to whomever lands in his sights.

199576.name: Legendary Swashbucklers
199576.description:
From publisher blurb:

En Garde!

Legendary Swashbucklers is a fantastic supplement for the most flamboyant fighters in the game, the dashing and dauntless swashbuckler. This new hybrid class, introduced in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Advanced Class Guide, was an evolutionary step in the idea of the light fighter who uses wits as well as weapons and style and speed over strength, and this book takes it to a whole new level with a redesigned legendary swashbuckler class, over a dozen swashbuckler archetypes (including variants of existing archetypes as well as brand-new ones like the tumbler and gallivant). Swashbucklers can add further depth and panache to their origins and abilities by adding personages that open up a whole new suite of skills, from the braggart and daredevil to the madcap and the masked phantom and more! The dervish darter prestige class lets all kinds of characters in on the fun, and an assortment of flashy and fabulous magic items will help outfit your mysterious marauder or audacious avenger ready to take on the world with a smile as bright as your blades.

199577.name: Spanish Civil War Battles: Teruel & Belchite
199577.description:
Spanish Civil War Battles is a simulation of the battles of Belchite (August-September 1937) and Teruel (December 1937-February 1938). The game uses an adaptation of the Fire & Movement system.

Each hex represents one kilometer. Each turn represents two days. Units are brigades and regiments of 3-4,000 men, and battalions of 400-800 men depending on type. Tank units represent Battalions or groups of companies of 30-40 tanks or armored cars. Support markers represent artillery battalions or squadrons of assault and bomber planes.

World at War #62 August 2018

199578.name: Penchant for Adventure - 2
199578.description:
From publisher blurb:

Penchant for Adventure – 2 is the solo adventure for a 2nd level character. This scenario puts a new but experienced adventure back into harm’s way. After arriving at the small community of Penchant for a festival, the PC quickly discovers that there is danger afoot! The citizens are reporting a bloodthirsty creature roaming the area threatening the festival. If this problem can be resolved a second and more dangerous challenge awaits them in a nearby cemetery. As with all adventures in the Penchant series it can be difficult and not for the faint of heart!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a 2nd level solo adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

199579.name: Terror Planet of the Amazon Queen
199579.description:
From publisher blurb:

Terror Planet of the Amazon Queen is a 35-page long pulp adventure for Savage Worlds, where the player characters have to face an invading army of warrior women from the innards of alien planet... in another dimension... from the future. The heroes will have to fight dinosaurs, strange predators, primitive warriors, interdimensional portals and will glimpse the true evil - strange Caretakers manipulating the plot behind the scenes.

This adventure contains enough setting material and story hooks to be an introduction to a pulp campaign of your own, exploring the wonders of Amazon planet; or it could be a stand-alone experience – we have provided a set of four pre-generated characters.

Dinosaurs, warrior women from another dimension, evil queens, technorganic sorcery – all that awaits your players.

199580.name: Jacob's Tower
199580.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jacob’s Tower is the critically acclaimed mega-dungeon for the Pathfinder RPG. Regardless of your world, plot, or players, it is easily run in any campaign or as a mega-dungeon.

Jacob's Tower is an adventure for 3 – 6 first through thirteenth level PCs using the Pathfinder RPG rules. It is 152 pages long, fully illustrated.

The dungeon is designed to test a party’s versatility and flexibility, utilizing every skill and creature type in the book over every three Levels. It both introduces new players to the wonders of Pathfinder and gives experienced players a non-traditional setting in which to test their skills.

This mega-dungeon never lags or slows down. Each combat is unique, interesting, and carefully crafted to deliver the best possible experience for GMs and players alike.

Don't expect intricate maps or complex artwork: the maps are basic and the artwork is in black and white. Expect incredible writing, imaginative challenges, and a mindblowingly fantastic time for you and your players.

199581.name: Undead Paragon Classes: Skeleton, Zombie and Vampire
199581.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wanted to play an undead? Undead Paragon Classes introduces three new 1-20 player classes: the Skeleton, Zombie and Vampire. These classes provide strong, balanced options for undead players while hitting all of the classics of each monster. Undead Paragon Classes also delivers a 0RP racial template, the Rotting Corpse, which can be added to any other race to make it undead. Why play a dwarf when you can play a rotting dwarf?

Included in Undead Paragon Classes:

The Skeleton, a foot soldier of the undead who wields steel and iron while terrifying the weak.
The Zombie, an unkillable monstrosity, who gets in close to impart disease, sicken or release insects from his host corpse.
The Vampire, master of those he summons, those he dominates, and those he creates, though reliant on a constant source of blood to function.
The Rotting Corpse, a 0RP racial template that can be added to any other race to make them undead.
17 new undead feats, such as Remove Head, Wraith-Touched and Grave Rider.
Raise Undead, a new spell that allows for transformation into an undead creature.

199582.name: The Gobber: A Thanksgiving Tale
199582.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every year for the past six years, Giblet Turkey Farms and Slaughterhouse has suffered some great tragedy on the eve of Turkey Day. Gunter and Drumstick Giblet have hired the party to protect their prestigious institution and get to the bottom of these mysterious matters. Through the night the PCs are visited by the Ghost of Turkeys Past, the Ghost of Turkeys Present, and the Ghost of Turkeys Future before coming face to face with the fearsome Gobbler.

Included in “The Gobbler:”

Six delicious turkey-based enemies
A bizarre yearly ritual of slaughter in the town of Pilgrim’s Rest
A mysterious new holiday themed curse
A new character race, the Awakened Turkey (only with purchase of the pdf)
Two sticks of butter and a dash of nutmeg




The Gobbler is a Thanksgiving one-shot meant for 3-4 second to fourth level PCs using the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game ruleset.

199583.name: En5ider (Issue 61 - Feb 2016)
199583.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's not only monks who fight with their fists - these subclasses for the barbarian, fighter, rogue (and, yes, one for the monk) bring out the pugilist in a variety of classes! The barbarian's fists are as strong as tempered steel with the Path of the Lodestar; the fighter masters the art of the heavyweight boxer as the Pugilist; the monk combines arcane magic and unarmed combat in the Way of the Arcane Fist; and the rogue moves at blinding speed as the Speedster. With new weapon properties, the new Fisticuffs fighting style, and two new spells, designer Josh Gentry will have your characters brawling in the taverns!

199584.name: En5ider (Issue 62 - Feb 2016)
199584.description:
From publisher blurb:

The eagerly awaited adventure has arrived - the first Act of the Holdenshire Chronicles! 41 pages of sandboxy goodness! The Holdenshire Chronicles takes EN Publishing’s classic adventure To Slay a Dragon and revamps it for a new generation of gamers. Using fifth edition rules, we hearken back to the 1980s and embark on an adventure which is sure to remind you of RPG modules and boxed sets long past! This trilogy of adventures leads an adventuring party from the town of Hengistbury on a journey across the land to challenge a red dragon who dwells in a volcano lair known as Skull Mountain. This first act begins with the characters in the town of Hengistbury, detailed previously in the Primer (EN5ider #56). There, they begin their progression as heroes, and learn all about the dragon Cirothe’s predations on the local area. As they advance in expertise and experience, the idea of tracking the dragon to her lair and ending her threat forever may become a more realistic prospect. Twelve mini-adventures make up this 41-page sandbox Act; these can be undertaken in any order, although some may be more difficult than others.

199585.name: En5ider (Issue 63 - Feb 2016)
199585.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever wanted an abyssal hide, balor wings, a devil's arm, a wretch's belch, an imp's eye, infernal horns, or vrock feathers? of course you have! Or at least, your 5E character has. Right? Designer Mike Myler brings you rules for infernal bodily alterations for those willing to make a deal with a devil!

199586.name: En5ider (Issue 64 - Feb 2016)
199586.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fate and luck are double-edged swords. Deities from ancient cultures - the Aztecs, Egyptians, Greeks, and Welsh - were rightfully wary of the gods of misfortune. This article from Dan Head introduces the god of ill-fortune, Jinx, one of the triumvirate which also includes Fate and Fortuna. Also described is the misfortunate domain, information on clerics of Jinx, and new magic items such as the No-Headed Coin.

199587.name: En5ider (Issue 65 - Mar 2016)
199587.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let your clerics embrace the elements and add some new domains to your 5E game - the flame domain, stone domain, water domain, and winter domain. Experience the Flame Cleric's Avatar of Flames, see how Reverent Stones part before your Stone Cleric, and be awestruck by the Water Cleric's Roar of the Waves!

199589.name: Beast Blaster
199589.description:
User Summary

A physics puzzler in which you blow up cute beasties with dynomite.

199590.name: Valiant Universe: The Deckbuilding Game
199590.description:
Hidden beneath Alcatraz Federal Penitentiary is a massive, hidden research installation run by the secretive organization known as project Rising Spirit. This mysterious installation, code named “the Facility,” uses unknown energies to morph and transform itself at will to keep horrid villains, dangerous creatures, alien entities, and top-secret research projects trapped within. Rumors of the Facility’s existence and its most prized possessions have leaked, and the Valiant Universe’s most powerful organizations—The Harbinger Foundation, the Renegades, GATE, and more—are taking an interest. The world may never be the same.

In Valiant Universe: The Deck-Building Game you command an organization attempting to seize the secret Alcatraz base. Purchase cards to craft a unique deck, and battle your way through the ever-changing Facility grid that moves during play to gain access to a card or damage another player. Maneuver your superhero miniatures to battle it out with other superheroes for ultimate control!

From the rules:
"Each player assumes the role of an
Organization within the Valiant Universe,
attempting to infiltrate the Facility and gain
control while fighting off any other Organizations
along the way.
The Facility is abstractly represented by a grid
of cards: 5 Levels (rows) x 5 Blocks (columns), for
25 decks of cards. Each deck on this grid is known
as a Sector.
To gain ultimate control of the Facility, each
player will play cards from their hands to deal
damage to other Organizations and manipulate
the cards in the grid—which represents the Facility
morphing and changing. Players will also have the
opportunity to purchase cards from their Zone of
Influence (ZOI) on the Facility. Additionally, players
can move their Superhero miniature around the
Facility’s Sectors to deal additional damage to
Opponents, while making use of their Abilities on
their Power card.
Along the way, the Facility may also strike
back at the players. As fighting rages throughout
the underground complex, damage is also inflicted
not just to Organizations but to the Facility as well,
marked using the Facility Durability Tracker. As
more damage is received, more Sectors
go into shutdown, making those cards
unavailable for purchase, as well as
potentially causing damage to a player’s
Organization.
As Organizations take damage, their
Cohesion drops; a measure of their overall
strength, morale, leadership, and ability to keep
fighting. If an Organization’s Cohesion ever drops
to 0, they retreat from the Facility and are
out of the game.
The last player remaining in the game
is the winner as they seize control of the
Facility and its exotic treasures!"

199592.name: Space Moth DX
199592.description:
Space Moth DX is an intense, old skool shoot 'em up featuring gorgeous pixel art, over 30 unique enemies, 5 massive stages and finger-blistering difficulty!

Source: The Developer Website.

199593.description:
The following items came with the Kickstarter edition of Slaughterville. Some of these will be available separately at the retail level, others will not.


Caleb, Hope, Brandi, Dylan, Rosie, and Xian Character Cards



Slaughterville Tourist Guide and Ticket to Slaughterville (Item cards)



Slaughterville Town Sign card


The following were results of stretch goals:


Walker's Carnival (24 card villain deck)



Herbert West Character Card



The House on Haunted Hill (24 card Location Deck)



Sherlock Holmes Character Card



Sleepy Hollow (24 villain deck and 1 Ichabod Crane Character Card



Jack the Ripper (30 card villain deck)


Note: the Dream Demon expansion was a $10 add-on otherwise it did not come with the KS pledge
199593.name: Slaughterville: Kickstarter Extras

199594.description: For a long time no one was even aware that this place existed. This place is one filled with horror and mystery. The House on Haunted Hill is an expansion to Slaughterville allowing you to discover this Location into your town!
199594.name: Slaughterville: The House on Haunted Hill Expansion

199595.description: You hear stories of people dying in their sleep and think nothing of it. Then more and more start dying in gruesome ways that seem to defy logic and physics. Your friends warn you not to fall asleep but exhaustion takes over and you drift off. Can you make it back before death claims you? The Dream Demon is an expansion to Slaughterville allowing you to introduce this Villain into your town to cause havoc on the citizens whether they are awake or asleep!
199595.name: Slaughterville: The Dream Demon Expansion

199596.description: The Horseman stalks Slaughterville. He is taking heads and leaving death and mystery behind! The Headless Horseman is an expansion to Slaughterville allowing you to introduce this Villain into your town!
199596.name: Slaughterville: The Headless Horseman Expansion

199597.description: The circus has come to Slaughterville. There will not be pony rides, games, or clowns. Instead you will have murderous strongmen, torture devices, and well, ok there are clowns but clowns are evil! Walker's Carnival is an expansion to Slaughterville allowing you to introduce this Villain into your town!
199597.name: Slaughterville: Walker’s Carnival Expansion

199598.description: The spirit of Jack the Ripper has returned and he has come to Slaughterville! Jack has possessed one of your friends and it is your job to find him. Unless you are Jack, then it is time to relive your infamy. Jack the Ripper is an expansion to Slaughterville allowing you to introduce this Villain and Player vs Player gameplay into your town to cause havoc on the citizens whether they are awake or asleep!
199598.name: Slaughterville: Jack the Ripper Expansion

199599.name: Journey Through Dreams
199599.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game have a single variable Attribute called Stillness. Stillness may be spent during play to increase a dice pool, but when Stillness is too low fewer dice remain in the pool. Character construction and other major aspects of the setting are determined randomly by card draw.

Note that the numerous custom cards required for play are not provided in the game but must be created prior to play. This would require substantive effort though the cards could be reused.

199600.name: Let's Dream
199600.description:
User summary:

This game is structured around a card game played with two custom decks (both provided as print-and-play components in the game document). Players take turn with narrative focus; other players constitute an audience. Each player's turn proceeds in defined phases. Simple tokens (e.g., paperclips) are passed to indicate relative success during the game. Card draws reveal components that are utilized during narrative development.

199601.name: Base Squad 49
199601.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Your standard shooter.

199602.name: Snomute
199602.description:
Designer's introduction:

Snomute is a Larp for 12-18 players to play in about 3 hours. In it we play characters living on a frozen world. I designed it to be played in and around a house with a decent-sized yard. But I’m sure you could make other spaces work as well. The game is GM-less and opts for a sandbox style of play rather then a baked-in story arc. The game is light on mechanics, involves sensory deprivation, and requires a lot of preparation and materials gathering.

199603.name: Developers Against Humanity
199603.description:
This is a promotional game released by the software company "Stackify" to entice people to demo their product.

It is a Cards Against Humanity clone, with all of the cards referring to software development and/or computer geek humor.

The rules are even expressed in scrum/agile terminology.

199604.name: Occyourpation
199604.description:
From the rulebook:

Occyourpation is a game of Financial Management, simulating the normal day to day costs of owning your own home and car, while at the same time running a business. The object of the came is to own your own $30,000 car, $100,000 house and have a nest egg from your businesses totaling $1,000,000!

Occyourpation is an 1978 Australian made board game made by Cassa products and is an Australian themed economic game.

In Occyourpation, much in the same vein as Monopoly, players throw dice and move around a board while purchasing objects they land on. Players however are gated on which paths on the board they are allowed to take, each path with different penalties and rewards, by their level of vehicle and income. Players are allowed to purchase shares, businesses, houses and cars aiming to earn more and more money and eventually reach the Victory condition.

199605.name: Battlefield 1

videogamehonor.39205: 2016 CVA Best International Game of the Year Nominee

199605.description:
User Summary

Battlefield 1 provides an incredible immersive combat experience melding a vast myriad of WW1-era vehicles, weaponry, and famous battlefields. Players take on one of 4 classes: Assault, Medic, Support, or Scout as they battle over various game modes including the always popular Conquest game type and several new ones. Battlefield 1 brings the world's greatest war to videogamers everywhere and includes both the expected MP portions along with several mini-campaigns that cover various theaters of WW1. Unlockable weapons and skins round out this latest offering from developers DICE.

199606.name: Battle Academy 2
199606.description:
Publisher blurb:

"Sequel to its successful predecessor, Battle Academy 2 moves the action east – to the bloodied plains of Mother Russia. When a gritty new look, great new features, and random mission generation meet battle-proven gameplay you can be sure of a turn-based strategy classic!"

199607.name: Agent Awesome
199607.description:
User Summary

A comedy strategy game where a drunk Agent Awesome is dared to take down an evil corporation by killing all the guards and employees in his way.

199608.name: Zamarian
199608.description:
Zamarian is a fast-paced shoot 'em up classic arcade action game brought to you in an exciting, colorful, and challenging new way!

Cross-platform multiplayer capability allows players from the PC, Mac, iPhone, iPad, and Android mobile devices to compete against each others.

This game offers a great collection of music soundtracks.

Your mouse or touchscreen skill will be challenged.

Zamarian, the brutal alien species, are in the final stage of destroying and finishing off the human race.

You are the last grind-it-out super-quick warrior to defend Earth's final hope.

Source: The Developer Website.

199609.name: Europa Universalis IV: Mare Nostrum
199609.description:
Mare Nostrum is the newest expansion to Paradox Development Studio’s best-selling historical grand strategy game, Europa Universalis IV. You now have even more tools at your disposal as you guide your nation through the early modern world. As its name suggests, Mare Nostrum introduces new systems connected to naval warfare and control of trade. The power of your fleets will depend on the number of sailors your nation can gather, and your ships can now be given missions and areas to patrol. There are also new options for creating trade leagues, and a host of other improvements.

Main Features

Map Sharing: This is a new diplomatic action, where you can ask other nations for their map of a certain region.
Naval Missions: New mission system makes it easier to send your fleets to a region, and expect them to survive.
Barbary Raids: North African Muslim states can raid the coastlines of their neighbors for gold and sailors.
Trade Leagues: Band together and form Trade Leagues for common defence and, more importantly, common riches.
Condottieri: Nations can rent their armies out to fight in other people’s wars, earning valuable coin for the realm.




Source: The Game Website.

199611.description:
Strategic board game with 88 glass marbles in three game variations

The Aim

To make a line out of marbles of your colour.

The Rules

Marbles are brought into play by sliding them onto the board from any one of its edges. Any marbles that are already there are simply pushed one space further along; however no marbles may fall off the other side of the board.

Game variations

In the game variations Shiftago Expert and Extreme, marbles can be removed from lines that have already been formed! This creates spaces along with new possibilities – but also new dangers.
199611.name: Shiftago

199612.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
Each player has a flight of fighters, represented by two-sided counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability. The entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

This set contains the P-38L Lightning. This twin-engine fighter was fast, and maneuverable. P-38s were used in both the European and Pacific theaters.
199612.name: Table Air Combat: P-38L Lightning

199613.name: Silver Knight
199613.description:
User Summary

Wander through a dungeon, clearing the levels and killing bosses. Features an 'isometric' map and random creature spawns, done in retro 8-bit graphics.

199614.name: Hypercorps 2099 (5E)
199614.description:
From publisher blurb:

The simultaneous tachyon flux of 1876 and 2076 forever changed the world, introducing a myriad of new races to Earth from other dimensions before the strange portals closed with the coming of the 20th century. The 200 years since have been filled with the miraculous rise of alter sapiens, the demigrant struggle for equal rights, and the ascent of the planet’s true masters: hypercorporations. Earth is firmly in the grip of these monolithic institutions, gradually being stripped away as more and more aspects of life are codified and monetized. For most this is a bleak and repetitious existence but for some it can be much more—for operators it offers an avenue to vast power, prestige, and wealth.

Hypercorps 2099 is a campaign setting and rule system for use with the 5th Edition of the world's most famous roleplaying game, taking adventurers into a cyberpunk future and granting them superheroic abilities that raise the drama of their tabletop game to unprecedented levels using the Hyper Score system. As operators the party will work for and against hypercorporations to frame executives, pull heists, sabotage laboratories or shipments, and whatever else their plutocratic overlords pay them to.

In the 204 page Hypercorps 2099 rulebook you’ll find:

A vibrant timeline explaining how the world of Hypercorps 2099 differs from the Earth of today
Over four dozen characters and 10 incredible full page illustrations by artist Nathanael Batchelor!
56 pages detailing six areas of the planet: apocalyptic Cleveland 2099, the digital dimension of the Hypernet, the mystical city of Kathmandu, the tumultuous landscape of Latin America, the hypercorporate mega-utopia of Lucrum, the megametropolis of Neo York, and the dark, vampire ruled lands of Wallachia
10 pages with 19 organizations and 46 hypercorporations in the world of Hypercorps 2099
An operating cast of fifty original NPCs including super teams, gang leaders, heroes, psychos, villains, and much more, giving GMs a plethora of allies and enemies to interact with operators
A hyper bestiary with 8 new templates and 18 new minions, drones, and monsters for GMs to use in any Fifth Edition game
A Gamemastering chapter with new skills, new tool kits, new security system traps, and essential tips for GMs running a game in the future (along with guidelines for games set in the late 1800s, during World War II, and in a modern setting)
Six new class archetypes (the ballistics brawler monastic tradition, cyber ninja rogue archetype, cyber samurai martial archetype, mechwarrior sorcerous origin, netjacker rogue archetype, and veloces monk tradition) as well as new character backgrounds for PCs in the future
A Hyper Equipment chapter with rules on advanced craftsmanship, advanced armor, the new arcanosteel material, cybernetics, gear, melee weapons, vehicles, and a host of futuristic firearms.
