But regardless of their habitat, their stories are also stuff of legends, parallel to those of their more scrupulous brethren: stories of cunning heists, daring escapes, cleverly executed plans to bring down a tyrant – and, indeed, outsmarting the Consortium and all other stuffed-shirt, dour-faced authority-figures who think they can tell the free-spirited scoundrel what he can and cannot do.

This humble booklet offers the White Star player and referee two new classes. First is the Assassin – a man (or woman!) trained in the art of precise killing and stealth. Second is the Rogue, a thief or spy skilled in getting into places people do not wish him to enter. Together with them, we present you with clarified and expanded stealth rules, two new ship modifications, five new weapons and two new pieces of gear. All together, we hope that this will open a secret door for you into the world of interstellar crime!

199965.name: Zeta and Tuko: Alien Character Classes
199965.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement centers on two playable character class for White Star - the alien Zeta with her powers of mind and rational nature and the reptilian Tuko hunters with their ambushing and climbing abilities. Together with these species comes a list of Psionics – mental powers possessed by the Zeta, some of which are similar to Meditations and Gifts as given in the White Star™ core book, while others are more unique. Additionally, this supplement adds two new starships – the archetypal Flying Saucer and the stealthy Tuko Hunter – as well as a few weapons and tools used by these two mysterious alien species.

The supplement includes:

Clarified rules for stealth and two-weapon fighting.
Zeta - "Grey Alien" playable class
Tuko - gecko-like reptilian hunter playable class
Hacking and Psionics rules for the Zeta
2 new starships
1 new starship modification
3 new weapons
2 new items of Advanced Technology

199966.description:
The realm of Kingsburg is under attack! Monstrous invaders are gathering at the borders, aiming to invade and plunder the realm! Your king has chosen you to take charge of a province on the border; you will manage your province and help defend the realm. To accomplish this, you must influence the King's advisors and the Royal Family to obtain gold, wood, stones, and soldiers to expand and defend your lands. But you are not the only governor seeking the aid of the advisers! The other players also seek to collect the best resources for their own territories.

King Tritus is waiting for you. Will you be able to be the most influent and powerful governor of the realm?

The game of Kingsburg takes place over five years, a total of 20 turns. In every year, there are three production seasons for collecting resources, building structures, and training troops. Every fourth turn is the winter, in which all the players must fight an invading army. Each player must face the invaders, so this is not a cooperative game.

The resources to build structures and train troops are collected by influencing the advisers in the King's Council. Players place their influence dice on members of the Council, and each adviser awards different resources or allocate soldiers, victory points, and other advantages to the player who was able to influence that adviser for the current turn. The player with the lowest influence dice sum is the first to choose where to spend their influence; this acts as a way of balancing poor dice rolling. Even with a very unlucky roll, a clever player can still come out from the Council with a good number of resources and/or soldiers.

At the end of five years, the player who best developed their assigned territory and most pleased the King through the Council wins.

Kingsburg (Second Edition) includes six expansion modules for use with the base game.
199966.name: Kingsburg (Second Edition)

199967.name: Succession: being a tale yet untold, of myth, might, and mystery
199967.description:
From the designer's marketing materials:

Succession is a lightweight, narratively focused fantasy roleplaying game for creating and exploring a dark, dangerous world as your adventurers embark on their quests. Setup and character creation is quick and straightforward, suitable for one-shot games, pickup games, and for play when your usual game is on hiatus.

In Succession, you play a mortal adventurer setting out on a quest, either given by your god, or in service to your home, or chosen freely for yourself. The gods are the main element defined in the setting you and your friends will create, and while none is purely good or evil, each god has difficult tenets to adhere to, and in return each offers a chance for greatness.

Your god will strongly influence your life, as you overthrow tyrants, traverse and tame frightening landscapes, explore forgotten temples, and defend your home and people from conquest, plague, and worse. While your god can make use of you no matter your skills, the relationship you forge (or break) with your faith and fellows will define you and your place in the world.

The simple, flexible, and clearly-written rules allow your group to explore many kinds of adventures, and the rules are designed to ensure that your adventurers can do anything their quest requires, if they risk and sacrifice enough. Resolution uses ordinary six-sided dice, and a typical session lasts four hours, including setup and character creation.

Succession is intended for 'GMless' play, in which every player has some of the responsibilities and privileges of a traditional GM, however the rules will still work if your group prefers to use a more conventional GM/player division.

Will you stand by as your world crumbles? Or will you venture into the unknown and discover your fate?

199968.name: Book of Sand
199968.description:
From the Introduction:

This book offers new ways to play Succession, both with new rules for the game you've played, and new games you can use Succession's rules to play. This hardly gives an encyclopedic inventory of what Succession can accomplish, and indeed, the kinds of stories you and your friends can tell together are endless. But within the offering this book provides, take note even of genres and sections that seem to offer nothing to you: every section includes novel rules that serve that section's goal. These new rules, like the new Deeds, can likewise serve other genres and styles of story. Indeed, several sections contain new approaches to a common facet of the game, from creating characters, to building the world, to setting up Quests.

These heterogeneous parts serve not just to provide tools, but to give instruction on how to create your own. The section on Horror, for example, shows how to combine lists of Blessings in new ways, still giving a thematic and guiding set of choices, but giving wider possibility in finding such a set. The section on Space Opera, by contrast, takes the simple existing Blessings and expressly uses them to denote supernormal powers and abilities.

With less than three dozen pages, this book is very finite, but every effort has been made to give you and your friends more stories than you can tell in a lifetime. It is the author's hope that the rules here serve to make the telling easy, fast, and fun.

199969.name: Royal Wedding
199969.description:
In the almost resplendent kingdom of the goblins, everything is ready for the nuptials of Princess Koncita. Well, almost ready... The preparations enrage the princess as everything seems to be going wrong for her. Koncita has a difficult character, and all around her hordes of terrified servants bustle about, attempting to satisfy her every tantrum, ahem, desire.

But even in the chaos of these preparations, while trying to dodge the possessions the princess flings at them (have you ever seen a flying chamber pot?!), the true nature of the goblins comes to the fore: Their infamous greed leads them to seek some small amount of vengeance not only against the princess, but against each other, too. Thus, in the excitement of the preparations, amongst the shoves and forfeits they have to put up with, maybe they will even manage to pinch a little treasure for themselves.

Royal Wedding is a fun-filled game for 2-8 disrespectful goblin servants!

199970.name: Black Caesar's Cache
199970.description:
An introduction to Modern Campaign Options: Treasure Hunter

From the introduction:

This mini-adventure is intended as an introduction to the Modern Campaign Options: Treasure Hunter supplement from Emerald Press, for use with the D20 Modern Roleplaying Game. Although it is designed for use with a party of first-level characters, it can easily be adapted for more powerful parties.

199971.name: Dungeon Crawl Unlimited
199971.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Dungeon Crawl Unlimited roleplaying game system. For those new to them roleplaying games (RPGs) involve one game master (GM) and two or more players. Each player takes on the persona (controls or runs) a character (player character or PC) in the game. The game itself takes place in a different world, a
different time or even a different reality. It may even be the modern world with a strange twist or three. The GM sets the stage and the players decide what their characters will do within it.

In many ways a roleplaying game is like a movie or TV series with the PCs as the heroes. The players are the actors and the GM takes on the job of director, producer, referee and actor for all the other characters within the story. It differs, though, in that the game is open-ended. There is no script! Each game session has an objective but the PCs (and players!) might not know what it is. Once the players know the objective, it is up to them, via their characters, to decide how to accomplish it.

rpgissuearticle.181635: Cultures of the Age of Empires

199973.name: Maze of Aeoklidias
199973.description:
From the Introduction:

Welcome to the Maze of Aeoklidias. Enter if you dare! Any time, any game any system.

Deep within the wilderness, atop a butte of ancient stone lies the Maze of Aeoklidias. There it has lain since before the Great Storm, though none who live now know of its purpose then. Whether ravaged by the Storm or purpose-built by some mad wizard, The Maze stands yet today.

One thing upon which all who voyage there agree is that The Maze exists still, as magical as ever. Fools have gone there seeking treasure and scowlers knowledge, wizards magic and warriors, skill. Those who returned to their kith and kin spoke only of the folly of the journey.

Welcome to the Maze of Aeoklidias, a centuries-ancient magical construction of unknown origin and purpose. What is known is that brave and hardy adventurers have faced the Maze and found treasure beyond mere gold and gems. Be warned, however. More enter the Maze than leave it. Are you up to the challenge?

The Maze of Aeoklidias is an adventure supplement written for the Dungeon Crawl Unlimited RPG system but usable in any other. The basic map contains sixteen simple elements, any of which can be combined and recombined for completely new adventures.

This is a puzzle and combat adventure. Upon entering the Maze, the characters are presented a Challenge. It's then up to them to solve the riddles, gather what they need and use it properly. Success opens the doorway out. Failure... Not really an option.

199974.name: Dungeon Crawl Unlimited Extra Forms Book
199974.description:
From the Back of the Book:

This booklet contains player and GM forms useful for the Dungeon Crawl Unlimited roleplaying game system. Character sheets, equipment and magic lists, they are all here. The GM will find organizers and information sheets to make running a DCU game even easier than it already is.

Besides the game forms there is extra material about the world of Epigaea. The calendar/weather/moon phase chart is included at its full size. There are two calendar/log sheets suitable for game log use and two maps showing the world beyond the Seven Kingdoms. There are also two blank maps to allow city and other feature placement.

Finally, there is a complete bonus adventure: Moon of the Goblin Sage. Set in the village of Plonk on the world of Epigaea, this adventure picks up where the introduction to Epigaea leaves off. Garvin the Minstrel spoke truly: the sages have arrived. Well, not quite. Perhaps if goblin bandits hadn't waylaid them along the way... Moon of the Goblin Sage presents a complete adventure that can start a DCU campaign or fit nicely into an existing one. It has new monsters, new magic items and a complete example of the DCU dungeon generator.

199978.name: Houserule (Issue 0 - Mar 2015)
199978.description:
Homebrew
Issue 0
March 2015

The D&D Wiki
Fire

Although Issue 0 was titled "Homebrew" the periodical's name was changed to "Houserule" almost immediately.

199979.name: Trigger Discipline
199979.description:
One by one, the Capulan city-states have fallen, and risen again under a single banner…
To the West, the machinists of the Uhrstadt demand autonomy…
To the North, the ancient Chonokhat clans swear to die before they kneel…
The balance of power is delicate, and the will of a few will decide the fate of the land…
Take part in the duels of these heroes, the greatest fighters ever to live…
Take part in the exciting combat of “Trigger Discipline”

Trigger Discipline is a fast-paced, mix-and-match, tactical card game set in the world of Gevahlt. Long ago, monstrous beasts called Titans roamed the land. Gunswordsmen from all over the world trained and competed in the Wild Hunt, an annual event where hopeful fighters would pit their wits and their gunswords against these powerful creatures. Now that the Titans are all but extinct, the denizens of Gevahlt have focused their skills on each other in dueling tournaments.

First, you pick a character from our roster of Duelists. Then, choose a Weapon for them to wield in battle. Every character has a favorite weapon, but these people are experts: they can fight with anything. With eight characters and eight weapons to mix and match in the Core Set, there are over 3000 unique 2-player match-ups right out of the box.

Your Duelist and Weapon will determine the cards in your deck. You’ll end up with 30 cards representing your skills in combat. Then you just set out your characters in starting position, shuffle up, and fight! Using two unique systems to represent the flow of combat, the Momentum resource and a modified Chess movement system, Trigger Discipline is a game for all ages and experience-levels to enjoy.

199980.name: The Best of Troll in the Corner (Vol 1 - Jun 2010)

rpgissue.35597: The Best of Troll in the Corner

199980.description:
The Best of Troll in the Corner
Volume 1
June 2010

199981.name: The Best of Troll in the Corner (Vol 2 - Dec 2010)

rpgissue.35597: The Best of Troll in the Corner

199981.description:
The Very Best of Troll in the Corner
Volume 2
December 2010

199982.name: Rude Awakening
199982.description:
From the Introduction:

This adventure was designed to serve as a starting point or major transitioning point for a given sci-fi campaign using any rules system, written to be game system agnostic by design.

This adventure is designed for 4 to 6 players with at least one character that has technician or engineering skills to help negotiate technical issues like jammed doors, and otherwise bypassing damaged or inoperable technology. At least one character needs to be a star ship pilot and another as a soldier or commando.

The characters form an elite team of troubleshooters serving some interstellar navy, and have been stationed on a large star ship or mobile space station with jump and maneuver drives. Destined for actions at a far away location requiring a vast distance to
travel, the adventurers are placed into cryogenic sleep pods to minimize life support requirements over such a long journey, thus are set on an 18 month cold sleep cycle before they are awakened at journey’s end.

199984.name: Academy Classroom
199984.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 302nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a medieval classroom at a magical academy.

The map is 14 x 20 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 4 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

The product has been updated to include a large gridless JPG image of the map, intended for use with VTT software. It is 2016x2880 pixels in size at 144dpi.

199985.name: Strikemaster Class Brig
199985.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gypsy Knights Games is proud to present the thirteenth entry in our line of products dedicated to the starships of Clement Sector.

As the end of the twenty-third century approached, the United States authorized construction of a small warship to reduce the need for the USSN to use larger vessels for escort and patrol duties. Like other major national powers the United States was finding that maintaining a space navy capable of defending her interstellar colonies was an expensive exercise and the hoped for economic offset from those colonies was, in reality, much lower than the projected outcomes had promised. In order to reduce the operating costs of the fleet without reducing its strength, it was determined that a smaller and thus less operationally expensive warship class was needed.

In 2293 Congress authorized the construction of the Strikemaster-class brig. The selection of the classification of “brig” caused some surprise as the US had not operated a brig for over four hundred years, that role, back in the age of sail, being replaced by fast frigates and corvettes. However, the use of the hull classification was revived with the new design performing exactly the same roles as those larger vessels but at a much reduced cost.

Ships of Clement Sector 13: Strikemaster-class Brig comes complete with beautiful views of the ship. The prospector is presented with full deckplans and statistics to make your use of our product simple, easy and fun. In addition, the ship comes with a set of adventure hooks to get your characters right into the action as well as a short story written by Bradley Warnes.

Though designed specifically with our Clement Sector setting in mind, this ship could easily be used in any science fiction setting.

Get on board! Adventure awaits!

199988.description:
This is a fan-made expansion available for download from the Hans im Glück website.

Mysterious fortune tellers have been appearing across the land of Carcassonne, possessing the ability to see what lies ahead. This rare profession may bring an advantage to those hoping to get a glimpse into the future…

This includes 8 new Fortune Teller tiles.

For every meeple on a fortune teller tent the player may draw 1 extra tile (up to 3) out of the bag at the beginning of his turn, and choose one.

When a tile with a fortune teller has tiles on every 4 sides, the tent has been completed and gets scored. The player, who placed the last of the 4 tiles gets 3 points.
199988.name: Carcassonne: Die Wahrsagerin

199990.name: Disney Descendants Head Hints
199990.description:
From the publisher:
"Heads up! It’s the game of clues, secrets, and silly stunts! Maleficent is up to her evil ways, and she’s mixed things up right before Ben's coronation! In this fun Head Hints game, your job is to put on your crowns and work as a team to defeat her. Can you guess what mystery character you are? If you can all guess 12 Mystery cards before 4 Maleficent cards show up, everyone’s a winner!


Includes 4 crowns (4 bands and 4 attachments), 20 Mystery cards, 30 Spell cards, and instructions with play mat.



Head Hints game challenges you to guess mystery characters
Everyone wears a crown
Work together as a team to guess characters
If you guess 12 characters before 4 Maleficent cards appear, everyone wins."

199991.name: Enchanter Class for Labyrinth Lord and OSR Games
199991.description:
From publisher blurb:
The most powerful spells of Prospero, the great magician of William Shakespeare's The Tempest, were not cast by his hand. He had his faithful air spirit, Ariel, cast them for him. Prospero is an Enchanter, cajoling a local elemental spirit to do his bidding.

In this class for Labyrinth Lord and OSR games, Enchanters can perceive and communicate with local nature spirits, such as nymphs, fairies, kami, and more. They don't cast spells, but rather they convince local nature spirits to cast spells for them. This class could also work with other kinds of spirits, such as spirits of the dead.

Inside, you'll find the Enchanter class, as well as simple rules for finding and commanding elemental nature spirits to do their bidding.

199992.name: A Hack of Class
199992.description:
From publisher blurb:

This supplement contains seven lightweight classes for The Black Hack: Assassin, Bard, Druid, Illusionist, Monk, Paladin, and Ranger. The also includes spell lists for druids and illusionists. It has been a pleasure to create these. I hope the reader can have fun with them.

199993.name: Starfaring Exploration for Delving Deeper
199993.description:
From publisher blurb:

Since Delving Deeper has such good, simple rules for handling wilderness, seafaring, and aerial exploration, I had to make one for starfaring exploration. DD/OD&D gets star ships.

199994.name: Delving Deeper: The Druid
199994.description:
From publisher blurb:

I like my classes simple, so here's a Druid for Delving Deeper and the OSR. Their special power is Command Animals, similar to the Clerics Turn Undead, only for animals. They can even take animals as retainers.

199995.name: D20 Girls Magazine (Vol 4, No 2 - May 2014)
199995.description:
D20 Girls Magazine
Volume 4, Number 2
May 2014

Free Comic Book Day Special Edition

199996.name: A Collection of Presentations Cartographical in Nature, Series 2015, Volume I
199996.description:
from the introduction

A collection of many of cartographical deviations presented to patrons of Matt Jackson. This document being the first volume of cartographical presentations from the year of our lord 2015.

199997.name: Curse of the Full Moon (5E)
199997.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition compatible adventure for four to six PCs Levels 4-5

“Have you ever been jostled awake by the shrill howl of a terrible beast? Felt the hairs on the back of your neck rise up, and goosebumps wash over your body like death’s cold caress? I have. For the past two weeks, every single night, a big wolf-like beast, covered in thick fur has invaded our normally quaint village, disturbing the peace. Right about the time this thing started appearing folks began reporting odd events in town. The dead are rising from their graves to torment the living. Many townsfolk have begun to pack to leave town. We just can’t live here anymore, it’s unholy and unsafe.”
“If you feel like helping out, the folk here in Rooknest sure would appreciate it. You can see the mayor ‘bought the job and the pay. Good luck, you’ll need it.”

A terrifying taste of what you’ll get in “Curse of the Full Moon”:

A new dark and forgotten deity, including full descriptions of her cult and rituals.
The Hellween and the Avatar of Alkumuoto, two terrible creatures to face on Hallow’s Eve.
Three beautifully terrifying new maps by 3x ENnie winning cartographer Todd Gamble.
A terrifying Halloween adventure filled with undead to haunt your players. Play it with candles.

199998.name: D20 Girls Magazine (Vol 3, No 3 - Summer 2013)
199998.description:
D20 Girls Magazine
Volume 3, Number 3
Summer 2013

Old School Sci Fi

200000.name: D20 Girls Magazine (Vol 4, No 1 - Winter 2014)
200000.description:
D20 Girls Magazine
Volume 4, Number 1

Doctor Who, Arthur Dent, and Harry Potter
